sub_title: ICT Test Manager at Erasmus University Rotterdam
summary:
I have a strong analytic intellectual capacity, which has been developed during my studies. I have the ability to analyze complex problems and reduce them to a manageable size. Combined with very good communicative skills I am able to share this ability with a wide range of different people within the organization 

Because of my communicative skills and perseverance, I know how to motivate people and get them to give their best effort in allowing the project to succeed.
Due to my enthusiasm and positive attitude, I am a team player pre-eminently. Furthermore I am reliable and result oriented.

I have focused on testing within the ICT business. Recently I have done various assignments as test manager. Keeping good relations with all concerned departments and persons in a project is of great concern to me. I’ve been active in the ICT business for 18 years now.

Languages: Dutch: mother tongue,	English: business fluent

profile_positions.title: Owner & Test Manager

profile_positions.description:
o	End to end responsibility to manage testing process according to IB IT principles.
o	Reporting to the IB IT test lead and the IB implementation manager
o	Ensuring all deliverables (vendor or otherwise) required for SIT, UAT, regression and all associated testing are reviewed by the IB IT test team lead and adjusted as required.
o	Create master test plan, including quality acceptance criteria
o	Create detail test plans for each system component/application where appropriate, in close corporation with engaged vendors 
o	Define, agree acceptance criteria for UAT/SIT/FAT/ORT
o	Derive, create (end-2-end) test cases (UI, Error, Negative, etc.) based on business requirements, making sure (where appropriate) that test cases align with vendor test cases
o	Assure End to end backwards Traceability (business requirements - UAT ) test cases and test plans including the UAT testing (process)” 
o	Creation, storage & maintenance of test data
o	Q/A for test data and it’s reusability 
o	Creation / consistency test environment in partnership with the engaged vendors and IB teams
o	Q/A for test environment
o	Lead (& line manage) testing team of local testers (if appropriate)
o	Drive test process in close corporation with involved vendor(s) and IB IT
o	Other responsibilities to be determined after development processes and expected deliverables for the project have been finalised
profile_positions.title: Test Manager

profile_positions.description: I have worked for EAI Service Center TIBCO as test manager in various EAI projects. EAI stands for Enterprise Application Integration and its mission is to make available the existing IT functionality to the business (KPN). Atos Origin is the supplier and is responsible for development and testing. Both activities are outsourced to Atos Origin India, this is the back office. As test manager, I was working in the front office in the Netherlands. I was responsible for the smooth communication between the front office and back office. I have also trained the testteam in India. The testing techniques were based on testing in a service oriented Architecture (SOA). Regression testing were performed with an automated testing tool, GH Tester. A lot of projects have been performed according Agile SCRUM. During user acceptance testing, I was intensively involved to grant support to the stakeholders. The defects from the user acceptance testing and chain testing were recorded in HP Quality Center. I was responsible to handle the defects correctly and to coordinate the regression testing when the fixes were ready. The test process is according  T-MAP and the V-model.
profile_positions.title: Test Manager

profile_positions.description:
responsibilities and activities:
•	Manage the testteam (8 testers)
•	Coordinate regression test for several Agile Scrum teams
•	Create test plan included with test strategy test approach and planning
•	Plan the test process, test guidelines and test procedures
•	Manage the test environment
•	Arrange and order the test tool license
•	Implement automated testing
•	Check quality of test execution whether it is according test strategy and test plan
•	Manage the system testing, system integration testing
•	Support user acceptance testing
•	Manage the defects during the testing
•	Maintain the test processes (testing according T-map)
•	Train new testers 
•	Check whether testing are executed according the test plan
•	Escalate to project manager when needed
•	Advising on testing field
•	Achieve milestones for test delivery
•	Create and deliver the test report to the stakeholders
•	Support the stakeholders during the User Acceptance Testing (UAT)

TMAP Next, Agile SCRUM, RUP Testing, Prince2, UML, ITIL, .NET/C# 3.0, Windows Communication Foundation (WCF),SOAPUI, Visual Studio.NET 2008, Team Foundation System (TFS)-Source Control and Work Items
profile_positions.title: Test Manager

profile_positions.description:
I was working for EAI Service Center Tibco SDMC as Testmanager and Testlead in several EAI projects. EAI uses TIBCO middleware to send messages.
EAI stands for Enterprise Application Integration and has as mission to make existing IT functionality inside the KPN application environment available for the business. The development and testing is done by Atos Origin. They have outsourced some activities to India. EAI Service Center has a Frontoffice in The Netherlands and a Back office in India. Most of the development and testing is done in India (70%).
One of my tasks was to improve the communication with the back Office. At this moment the  offshore track is a great success. Communication is mostly done by email and instant messaging (Agora and Skype). EAI Service Center Tibco develops Adapters (Components). These adapters translate and map messages to the TIBCO BUS. The testteam tests these adapters with stubs and drivers. The test techniques are based on testing in service oriented architecture (SOA).  Regression testing is done with an automated test tool,  GH-Tester.
 A few projects were tested per component according the RUP method. I was also allocated to support the Business during the User Acceptance Testing (UAT). During the UAT the defects were registered and handled in HP Quality Center. The testprocess is according the TMAP method. The testteam is in a early stage involved to review the design documents according the V-model.

profile_positions.title: Testmanager

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities and activities Testmanager and Testlead:
•	Responsible for and contact point for the connection between the Atos Origin testprocess and the KPN development process
•	Responsible for the quality of the testdeliverables to KPN
•	Responsible for the knowledge level of the test processes in the Back Office (India) through education
•	Responsible for the quality of the automated GH-Tester scripts
•	Support testprocess EAI Service Center Tibco (according  T-map)
•	Communicate with and keep good relations with the backoffice in India (offshore team)
•	Manage Lead Testers (3) and Testers (15)
•	Advise Project Managers AtosOrigin
•	Advise and Inform KPN EAI Test managers demand
•	Making of Test Calculations and Impact Analysis for projects and Change Requests
•	Train new testers
•	Conduct Test meetings
•	Clean Order Validatie: review of Design documents
•	Review Testplan and Logical testcases
•	Review Physical testcases in GH-Tester
•	Review Final Testreport
•	Delivery test deliverables to KPN 
•	Discuss the testplan and testreport with KPN Testmanager
•	Deployment requests adapters to TAB team (Technisch Applicatie Beheerder)
•	Advise projectmanager about the needed skill, capacity and available/competent    tester
•	Monitor that the tests are being executed as described in the testplan and Logical testcases.
•	Escalate to Project manager if needed
•	Advise on test issues
•	Intermediair between the testteam BackOffice (offshore India) and KPN EAI demand NL.
•	Maintenance of the defectregistration Tool: Clearquest and HP Quality Center
•	Maintenance of testware in ClearCase
•	Coaching of testers in Backoffice India and leadtesters NL
  Analyses and propositions for improval:
•	Gap analysys between the “fixed and mobile” testprocesses
•	Presentation to KPN with a proposition for improval (integration) for test processes “fixed and mobile”
•	Structure Testprocess
•	Update and improve Sox compliancy test documents (for EAI)
profile_positions.title: Test Manager

profile_positions.description:
	TUMS builds adapters by order of KPN. These adapters are linked to the tibco Bus. The front-end users can request information directly over the tibco bus. These messages have an RV format.
	I’ve been working on the project EAI, Enterprise of Application Integration. I’ve tested several adapters. These adapters transfer the http(s) SOAP message build on wsdl into Rendezvous Message. A few times, an adapter has been built on a workflow or a task flow. These flows contain business logic and the tests are functional. The system integration tests are executed with teststubs, based on XML, with Tibco Designer and GH-test. GH-test is used to capture the request and response message on the tibco bus. The following front-end and backend applications are integrated into the tibco Bus: KSD, Expertdesk, AR, Kanvas, Viertel, Engine, MM007, BaanBC, ORacleAR, NIM, NIS. CKR, IKK, PIO, OFM, COIN, TVbilling, KPN.COM, TIE, MSR OM,
	Coordinate the test team, review design documents, review test documents, design templates for test documents, Prepare test scripts SIT(System Integration Test) and FAT(Factory Acceptance Test), create test plan, testing, witness test, enter defects into clearquest, enter documents into Clear Case, leading test team (5 testers), focal point for test manager, project managers, build manager and lead build.
profile_positions.title: Lead Test/Senior Tester

profile_positions.description:
•	Epacity is a new service of KPN, and developed for the business market. Epacity is a service of Epacity Solutions. The service is based on a broadband Virtual Private Network, combined with an automated delivery process. This makes Epacity a unique service. Before an order is processed it goes through the chain. The chain is as follows: Entrust Getacces, Bussiness Connect, Order Entry, Siebel eCOMM, Portal Infranet, Mainbrain SAS, Cramer Dimension, Micromuse Netcool, Remedy ARS, Radius ARS, Radius Gui, Radiatorproxy, Radiator Authentication, PACMAN, Business Objects
•	Management of all applications, create accounts for Ecco in Getaccess, create Siebel accounts, partially create VPN’s, write work instructions, create reports, e.g SOWO(number of orders) and NIPO(client data) from the Bussiness Objects Report, find errors and report them in clearquest, find documents and patches in Clearcase, Plan and coordinate own activities, testing of patches on preproduction and production, telephonic support of the CSD, order confirmation, billing and OB., contacts with external parties, CDS Heerlen, Operational management Groningen, CSD en TSD
•	Flowcharts, Structured workshops
•	MS-Excel, MS-Word, MS-outlook,, Oracle 4/5 database, Internet, Unix, TOAD
